widget.name: Tree View
widget.description: Advanced treegrid to browse and manipulate refences and referencesets

property.caption: 1) Entities
property.description: Define all the types of objects that are displayed in the treeview here. The object type of the context is required here is as well!

property.caption: Sort attribute
property.description: Attribute to sort this type of objects on. If DnD is used, this should be a float.

property.caption: Cache burst attribute
property.description:
Depending on the value of this property, the children of an item will be reloaded. If this property is omitted, the widget tries to automatically discover which items need to be refreshed, but new objects with a from child assocation cannot be detected automatically.
!Important note!: If a cacheburst attribute is set, this attribute needs to be update to show new children on assiations which are owned by children and use an xpath constraint. This way it can be assured that items do not slip past constraints by changing them.
Furthermore, the cacheburst is used as hint when to expand items. If the cacheburst of an item changes after invoking a microflow, it is assumed that there are new children to display. The item is expanded and the newest child will be selected.

property.caption: Style
property.description: Define CSS properties here. Use newline or '|' to separate CSS properties (';') is not allowed!

property.caption: Formloader Channel
property.description: If provided, all formloaders listening to this channel will follow the current selection

property.caption: 2) Relations
property.description:
You can define the relations that are shown in the tree here. Relations are defined per relation per direction. The root object of the tree is always the context object.
Example: Domain model: Orderline *---orderline_order-->1 Order
Configuration to show all orderlines within an order (which is the context object):
Association owner: 'Orderline' Association (reference): 'orderline_order' Association direction: 'The association owner is the child'
It is allowed to add an additional relation, with association direction 'The association owner is the parent', to be able to expand from the orderline back to the order (which might make sense if an orderline would be related to multiple orders).

property.caption: Name / caption
property.description: Describe this relation

property.caption: Association (reference)
property.description: The association from owner entity type to the other entity

property.caption: Association (referenceSet)
property.description: The association from owner entity type to the other entity

property.caption: Association direction
property.description: This property describes whether the selected defines whether this association is from parent <-- child (default) or child --> parent

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: The association owner is the child
The association owner is the parent

property.caption: Constraint
property.description: Optional constraint on the relation. Note that using constraints might introduce the need to use the burst attribute, as the treeview cannot predict reliable anymore in which parents should be updated if the parent association changes.

property.caption: Show relation name
property.description: Show the name of the relation as a separate node, and group children in it. The style properties will affect this node if true.

property.caption: Style
property.description: Define CSS properties here. Use newline or '|' to separate CSS properties (';') is not allowed!

property.caption: Allow drops
property.description: Allow items to be dropped in this association

property.caption: Allow drop copies
property.description: Allow items to be dropped as a copy in this association (not supported for single references where fromparent is false)

property.caption: On drop microflow
property.description: This microflow is triggered if a drag and drop action of the user results in a change for this relation (for both add and remove (if referenceset)). The microflow is always invoked on the owner of the association. So if the association owner is the child (default) the microflow will be triggered for the item being dropped, but if the association owner is the parent, the microflow will be triggered on the item being dropped *ON* and the item being dropped *FROM* (if referenceset).

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: Display current object or referenced FileID attribute as thumbnail
Display current object or referenced FileID attribute as image

property.caption: Attribute
property.description: Attribute to display

property.caption: On click action
property.description: The name of the action that should be invoked when this item is clicked. The name should refer to the name of an action as defined in step 4) Actions

property.caption: Class
property.description: The following classes are available by default: 'link', 'newline' (starts a newline before this value), 'right' (right align) 'separator', 'large' and 'small'

property.caption: Style
property.description: Define CSS properties here. Use newline or '|' to separate CSS properties (';') is not allowed!

property.caption: Column date time format
property.description: The formatting of the date if a datetime attribute is displayed.

property.caption: Action name
property.description: The name of this action, as can be refered to in step 3).

property.caption: Hide if disabled
property.description: Whether to hide, or only disable the button when it can't be pressed.

property.caption: Is default action
property.description: If true, this action will be used as default action and be invoked if the item is doubleclicked or the return key is pressed.

property.caption: Confirmation message
property.description: If set, users have to confirm this message before continuing

property.caption: Fire on selection change
property.description: Invoke this action immediately when the current selection changes. For more information about retrieving the current selection, see the 'fine tuning > Selection reference' properties

property.caption: 5) Selection References
property.description: Define all the necessary selection references here.

property.caption: Selection reference
property.description: This reference is updated as soon as the selection changes. This is useful to determine the current selection if action that fires on selection changes is used (see actions). For that action, set a microflow for the context action. The value of the reference selected here will be updated before that action fires.

property.caption: Hide root node
property.description: If false, the root node is displayed. If true, the root node hidden and only its children are displayed

property.caption: Expand mode
property.description: How should the tree expand? Click Arrow : Expand items when an arrow is clicked Click Row : Expand items if a row is clicked somewhere Accordion: Expand items if a row is clicked somewhere, but collapse all other, not descendant items.

property.caption: Auto expand depth
property.description: If true all items up to the selected depth will be expanded automatically. A higher number will increase the initial load time.

property.caption: Prefetch data
property.description: If true, items at deeper levels of the tree will be prefetched. This improves the user experience, but requires more resources. Should be turned of for very large datasets.
